subject: Second wave of tornadoes rakes Plains

Second wave of tornadoes rakes Plains





Tornadoes tore across the nation's midsection for a second night Saturday, 24
hours after a storm leveled Greensburg, Kansas.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Sinai crash kills 9 peacekeepers





As many as nine foreign peacekeepers, including up to eight French soldiers,
were killed Sunday when a French plane attached to the Sinai's multinational
peacekeeping force crashed in a remote, mountainous area of the desert, the
force's spokesman said.

L.A. mayor 'deeply troubled' by use of force at rally





Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa condemned the Los Angeles Police Department's use
of force against demonstrators and reporters at an immigration rally, saying
he was "deeply, personally troubled" by the clash.





FULL STORY
















Officials order 20 million chickens held from market





Federal officials on Friday placed a hold on 20 million chickens raised for
market in several states because their feed was mixed with pet food containing
an industrial chemical.





FULL STORY
















Kentucky Derby bows to Queen Elizabeth





For a few exciting moments, Queen Elizabeth II was just like every other
racing fan Saturday at Churchill Downs -- watching the horses running in the
133rd Kentucky Derby.





FULL STORY
















NRA opposes bill to stop gun sales to terror suspects





The National Rifle Association is urging the Bush administration to withdraw
its support of a bill that would prohibit suspected terrorists from buying
firearms.





FULL STORY

Rescuers prepare to resume search for jet





Crews in southern Cameroon prepared to resume their search Sunday for a
missing Nairobi-bound Kenya Airways flight that disappeared the day before
during heavy rain.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Thousands greet suspended Pakistani judge





Tens of thousands of Pakistanis who had waited through the night gave a
tumultuous reception on Sunday to the judge who defied President Pervez
Musharraf as he arrived in the city of Lahore.





FULL STORY
















France begins voting for president





French voters began casting their votes on Sunday in the presidential runoff
contest between conservative Nicolas Sarkozy and Socialist Segolene Royal.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Baghdad suicide bomber targets police recruits





A suicide bomber killed 15 people, mostly police recruits, outside an Iraqi
army base west of Baghdad on Saturday in a fresh attack on volunteers for the
U.S.-trained local security forces.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO

Where gasoline is cheap





In Saudi Arabia gasoline costs about 45 cents a gallon. In Iran it's 33 cents.
Venezuelans pay less than a quarter.





FULL STORY
















Buffett's throne may have 4 heirs





Warren Buffett said on Saturday he might hire up to four people to succeed him
as chief investment officer of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., and cautioned that
recent strong results from the company's insurance operations are
unsustainable.

SPORTS

Mayweather outlasts De La Hoya to win WBC title belt





Floyd Mayweather Jr. couldn't win over the crowd, or even his own father. All
he could win was the only thing that really counted Saturday night, his fight
against Oscar De La Hoya.





FULL STORY
















Street Sense wins Derby





Street Sense showed plenty of that, smartly picking his way through traffic
while rallying from next-to-last in a 20-horse field to win the Kentucky
Derby.

DNA mutation boosts heart disease risk in whites





A treasure hunt for genes has found that up to three-quarters of people of
European descent have DNA that raises their risk for heart disease -- and
these genes are close to a stretch of DNA linked to diabetes.





FULL STORY
















BBQ lovers may have higher breast cancer risk





Postmenopausal women who like barbecued and smoked meat would be wise to eat
plenty of fruit and vegetables too, a new study suggests.

Review: 'Spider-Man 3' video game a blockbuster





With the video game version of "Spider-Man 3" and its theatrical counterpart
hitting the United States on Friday, we're not just seeing the continuation of
a hugely successful movie franchise. 





FULL STORY

Wind farms offer more power, possible problems





Wind farms could generate as much as 7 percent of U.S. electricity in 15
years, but scientists want to spend more time studying the threat those
spinning blades pose to birds and bats.

Paris Hilton sentenced to 45 days in jail





A judge sentenced Paris Hilton to 45 days in county jail Friday for violating
her probation, putting the brakes on the hotel heiress's famous high life.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















'Spider-Man 3' breaks 1-day record





"Spider-Man 3" sold a record $59 million worth of tickets during its first day
of release across North America, and is on track to break the industry mark
for an opening weekend, according to estimates issued Saturday by the film's
distributor.
